item.title: Tip: Commands To Find Out The Shell You Are Using
item.description: Many times you might not be sure about which shell you are currently using. Especially if you are not on your system and logging into someone else’s, or maybe ssh’ing into a remote server. Worry not, because here are few simple commands that you can use to find out which shell you are using currently. Command (Note: This one is a bit unreliable as it might not work with non-bash shells or on redirection.
